00025 #define PROPERTY_PTR(type,name)\
00026         public: \
00027                 type name;\
00028         public:\
00029                 type get_ ## name() \
00030                         { return name; }\
00031                 void set_ ## name(type value)\
00032                         { name = value; } \
00033                 type* lea_ ## name() \
00034                         { return &name; }
00035 
00036 //Not gettable/settable members
00037 #define PROTECTED_PROPERTY(type,name)\
00038         protected:\
00039                 type name; \
00040         public:
00041 
00042 // following westwood's style
00043 #define VALIDTAG(str) \
00044         (strcmpi("<none>", str) && strcmpi("none", str))
00045 
00046 /*
00047 Operation: The Cleansing
00048 
00049 These two replace a function's implementation.
00050 
00051 R0 is used for functions which return a numeric value or a pointer.
00052 RX is for functions without a return type.
00053 Functions that return struct instances will have to be written manually.
00054 
00055 I chose short names to keep things clean.
00056 
00057 Example usage:
00058 virtual int foo(int bar) R0;
00059 virtual void alla(double malla) RX;
00060 */
00061 
00062 #define R0 {return 0;}
00063 #define RX {}
00064 
00065 #endif
